name: PipWheel
description: Creates wheels using pip from all installed copies of Python.
helpMarkDown:
The *Build Python wheels with pip* task uses the `pip wheel` command to compile wheels. This may be passed either the source directory to build, or the names and versions of packages that have already been published on the [Python Package Index](https://pypi.org). It will ensure that `pip`, `wheel`, `setuptools` and `cython` are installed before running.

As the Python packaging ecosystem moves forward, the `pip wheel` command is likely to be more reliable than using `setup.py`.
author: Steve Dower

inputs.name: packages
inputs.label: Packages
inputs.helpMarkDown: Packages to build into wheels. By default, builds from sources directory. Used as an argument to `pip wheel`.

inputs.name: outputdir
inputs.label: Output Folder
inputs.helpMarkDown: Folder where wheels will written. By default, `$(Build.BinariesDirectory)\dist` is used.  The `PipWheel.dist` output variable is set to this folder.

inputs.name: pythonpath
inputs.label: Python
inputs.helpMarkDown: Directory containing the `python.exe` to use. By default, the last install added by either the Install Python or Use Python task will be used.

inputs.name: dependencies
inputs.label: Dependencies
inputs.helpMarkDown: Packages to install prior to building wheels. Prefix with `--upgrade` to ensure you have the latest version.

outputVariables.name: dist
outputVariables.description: The directory distribution files were written to.
